channel.title: Facebook on Laura Kalbag
channel.description: Recent content in Facebook on Laura Kalbag

item.title: The Sticky, Pocked Underbelly Of The Web
item.description: This week’s roundup covers Swiss Cheese Internet vs The Database Of Ruin, The Right To Be Forgotten, and Diversity. Lots of variety!

item.title: Windows To Your Soul
item.description: In this week’s Ind.ie roundup, I wrote about privacy, politics, tracking, Timelines, and a little thing called “corporate nullification.”

item.title: The Social Web: A Glorious Dystopia
item.description: Lots of good quotes and a book recommendation in this week’s Ind.ie roundup.

item.title: The Destiny Machine
item.description: Last Friday’s roundup was back to business as usual, after a couple of weeks of re:publica-related work. We’ve got the latest in the world of Spyware 2.0, and some fun ways that people are challenging the system.

item.title: Europe fights back
item.description: Last Friday’s Ind.ie roundup had more on corporate surveillance, a couple of great videos with Edward Snowden, and Europe fighting back against Google and Facebook. It took me a long time to pull it all together. I’m going to have to start writing my Friday roundups on Thursday! If you know of any interesting or relevant links, please let me know :)

item.title: Will understanding the mainstream affect me as a designer?
item.description: I’ve been contemplating how designers can identify better with more mainstream users. I had a thought last week. What if, by rejecting Facebook, I’m actually missing out on design patterns that are so influential on the mainstream user that it affects their perception on the rest of the web? And the same goes for Google Chrome. I’ve been going through a rebellious anti-Google phase, but now Chrome has taken over as the world’s most popular browser, am I making life harder for myself by developing sites in Safari first?
